gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
gospel.text:
[[Lc 1,26]]In the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee called Nazareth,
[[Lc 1,27]]to a virgin betrothed to a man named Joseph, of the house of David, and the virgin's name was Mary.
[[Lc 1,28]]And coming to her, he said, "Hail, full of grace! The Lord is with you."
[[Lc 1,29]]But she was greatly troubled at what was said and pondered what sort of greeting this might be.
[[Lc 1,30]]Then the angel said to her, "Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
[[Lc 1,31]]Behold, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you shall name him Jesus.
[[Lc 1,32]]He will be great and will be called Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give him the throne of David his father,
[[Lc 1,33]]and he will rule over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom there will be no end."
[[Lc 1,34]]But Mary said to the angel, "How can this be, since I have no relations with a man?"
[[Lc 1,35]]And the angel said to her in reply, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you. Therefore the child to be born will be called holy, the Son of God.
[[Lc 1,36]]And behold, Elizabeth, your relative, has also conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month for her who was called barren;
[[Lc 1,37]]for nothing will be impossible for God."
[[Lc 1,38]]Mary said, "Behold, I am the handmaid of the Lord. May it be done to me according to your word." Then the angel departed from her.

psalm.title: Book of Judith
psalm.text:
[[Jdt 13,18b]]Blessed are you, daughter, by the Most High God,
[[Jdt 13,18c]]above all the women on earth;
[[Jdt 13,18d]]and blessed be the LORD God,
[[Jdt 13,18e]]the creator of heaven and earth,

[[Jdt 13,19]]Your deed of hope will never be forgotten 
by those who tell the might of God.

first_reading.title: Book of Zechariah
first_reading.text:
[[Za 2,14]]Sing and rejoice, O daughter Zion! See, I am coming to dwell among you, says the LORD.
[[Za 2,15]]Many nations shall join themselves to the LORD on that day, and they shall be his people, and he will dwell among you, and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you.
[[Za 2,16]]The LORD will possess Judah as his portion of the holy land, and he will again choose Jerusalem.
[[Za 2,17]]Silence, all mankind, in the presence of the LORD! for he stirs forth from his holy dwelling.
